intro: Racosperma barbinerve, commonly known as the hairy-veined acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features prominent, hairy veins on its leaflets, which give it its scientific name. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typical of many acacia species. Racosperma barbinerve is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
